Key Performance Indicators (KPI) Basics Erik Wilde (@dret): KPIs for APIs: You Cannot Manage What You Cannot Measure

(3) KPI Overview

  • Providing measurable indicators for performance of organizations or activities
  • KPIs often are designed to follow the SMART criteria [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SMART_criteria]
    • Specific: Target a specific area for improvement
    • Measurable: Quantify or at least suggest an indicator of progress
    • Assignable: Specify who will do it
    • Realistic: State what results can realistically be achieved, given available resources
    • Time-related: Specify when the result(s) can be achieved
  • Like any other measurement KPIs are subject to Goodhart's Law [Goodhart's Law (1)]


Key Performance Indicators (KPI) Basics Erik Wilde (@dret): KPIs for APIs: You Cannot Manage What You Cannot Measure

(4) Goodhart's Law

When a measure becomes a target, it ceases to be a good measure. (Charles Goodhart [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Goodhart])


Key Performance Indicators (KPI) Basics Erik Wilde (@dret): KPIs for APIs: You Cannot Manage What You Cannot Measure

(5) Example: Number of APIs

  • Interesting indicator but little indication of API value
  • Differentiating public/partner/private helps to better track API focus
  • Good idea to classify by reuse factor (number of API consumers)

KPI Perspectives Erik Wilde (@dret): KPIs for APIs: You Cannot Manage What You Cannot Measure

(7) Operational Perspective

  • Important for API management
  • Indicators for how easy it is to publish APIs
  • Indicators for how easy it is to consume APIs
  • Indicators for performance of API data plane
  • Indicators for performance of API management plane


KPI Perspectives Erik Wilde (@dret): KPIs for APIs: You Cannot Manage What You Cannot Measure

(8) Business Perspective

  • Important for digital building block management
  • Indicators for building block utilization
  • Indicators for building block productivity
  • Indicators for building block performance
